numberFormat
Displaying a number in the specified format.
Syntax
numberFormat
(number, format, [lang_scheme])
Setting
Purpose
number
Source numeric value.
format
Formatting pattern as a
string
. Defining the output structure: number of digits, separators, prefixes/suffixes, and other display parameters (described
below
).
lang_scheme
Language scheme
(locale). Defining regional standards for displaying numbers: decimal separator symbol, digit grouping separator, and other localized elements.
The parameter value is set by selecting an object from the "Language schema" directory [SYS_LANG_SCHEMA] using the
dict
function.
This parameter is optional.
If the parameter is not specified, formatting is performed according to the user’s locale.
Note
The function is called from the
"Algorithms"
tab of the algorithm editor toolbar.
When the function is called, dummy variables
"number"
and
"format"
are set; replace them with the required values.
The formatting pattern is specified according to the following rules:
Symbol
Position in pattern
Purpose
Example (Number → Pattern → Result)
0
Main pattern
Mandatory digit.
Always displayed, even if there is no digit in the corresponding position of the number (replaced with zero).
123 → "00000" → "00123"
#
Main pattern
Optional digit.
Displayed only if there is a significant digit in this position. Leading and trailing zeros are hidden.
12 → "###" → "12"
.
Main pattern
Decimal separator.
Separates the integer and fractional parts of the number.
0.5 → "0.0" → "0,5"
in the Russian locale
0.5 → "0.0" → "0.5"
in the English locale
,
Main pattern
Digit grouping separator.
Used to visually separate units, thousands, millions, etc.
1234 → "#,###" → "1 234"
in the Russian locale
1234 → "#,###" → "1,234"
in the English locale
E
Main pattern
Exponent separator.
Separates the mantissa from the exponent when formatting a number in scientific notation.
0.012 → "0.##E0" → "1.2E-2"
%
Prefix or suffix
Percent.
Multiplies the number by 100 and adds the % symbol in the specified position.
0.85 → "0%" → "85%"
‰
Prefix or suffix
Per mille.
Multiplies the number by 1000 and adds the ‰ symbol in the specified position.
0.085 → "0‰" → "85‰"
'
Prefix or suffix
Escape character.
Allows special symbols to be output as plain text.
12 → "'#'0" → "#12"
;
Separator
Subpattern separator.
Defines different formats for positive, negative numbers and sometimes zero.
-5.1 → "0.0;(-0.0)" → "(-5.1)"
-
Prefix or suffix
Default minus sign.
Automatically added to negative numbers if no special subpattern is specified.
1245 → "-##" → "-1245"
Rounding is performed according to the standard mathematical rule.
Find more about building a pattern
here
.
